content:
My understanding is that declarative macros 2.0 are waiting on design work, and have been for years, in the wake of RFC 1584. It would be nice to see them finished, since they would represent a real ergonomics improvement.

I'm not even vaguely qualified or able to see the requisite work done. However, now does seem to be the time for bringing such things up, so I thought I'd mention it.
If someone were willing to own the design work, I think we might consider it. It fits into the theme of empowering library authors.
